pr_title: Add option to remove studies giving study Id

timeline.bodyText: maybe we should mention to the user that this is used in conjunction with the remove-study command? Otherwise some may think this must be supplied during an import.
timeline.author: sheridancbio
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -357,6 +371,7 @@ def usage():
                            '--command [%s] --study_directory <path to directory> '
                            '--meta_filename <path to metafile>'
                            '--data_filename <path to datafile>'
+                           '--study_ids <cancer study ids, comma separated>'

replies.bodyText: second that. Really command should be a proper subcommand instead of an option. Each command should have it's own options
replies.author: inodb

replies.bodyText: I created an issue for this: #7201. It would be good tho to mention like Rob said that this is only for the remove-study command
replies.author: inodb

replies.bodyText: Refactoring this script so that options are context-sensitive to the command could be an issue with the "good first issue" tag. But we also are hoping to replace the importer and scripts package entirely with a standalone code base (this year?)
replies.author: sheridancbio

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the context @sheridancbio ! Since it would be a pretty minor change I think it can be ok for a first issue even tho we might decide to retire the code altogether, but that's def good to know!
replies.author: inodb

replies.bodyText:
My suggestion would be to change this line to:
'--study_ids <cancer study ids for remove-study, comma separated>'
replies.author: sheridancbio

replies.bodyText: @inodb @sheridancbio I have updated the user help lines in the script as per your suggestion.
replies.author: pvannierop

timeline.message: Add option to remove studies giving study Id
